intro: Senecio caracasanus, commonly known as the Caracasanus groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. It features narrow, linear leaves and produces small yellow flowers arranged in clusters. Senecio caracasanus is often used in rock gardens due to its low maintenance and ornamental value.
